Description: Body sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery phiale mesomphalos; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black; part of lotus flower and rosette chain in added white outline with added red centres above two white lines; below, alternating red and black tongues with white outlines; exterior: painted decoration consisting of lion to right (parts of hindquarters and body with red patches, part of lower open jaw and forelegs remaining); below, band of dots between pairs of lines.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 298, no. 991)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1990) (phase 2)
